module.name: Antwerp I/O module
module.description: This VSCP module has 28 outputs, 3 opto isolated inputs, 4 0-10V outputs

reg.name: Zone
reg.description: Zone this module belongs to

reg.name: Subzone
reg.description: Subzone this module belongs to

reg.name: output 1 status register
reg.description:
Writing a value to the output control register will activate/deactivate the output output.
 0 - The output is not active.
 1 - The output is active.

reg.name: Control byte for output 1
reg.description:
The output control bits enable/disable output associated functionality:
 Bit 0 - Reserved.
 Bit 1 - If set: Alarm sent when protection timer triggers.
 Bit 2 - Protection timer enable.
 Bit 3 - Send On event when relay goes to active state.
 Bit 4 - Send Off event when relay goes to inactive state.
 Bit 5 - Reserved.
 Bit 6 - Reserved.
 Bit 7 - If set to one the relay is enabled.

reg.name: Subzone for output 1
reg.description: This is a subzone related to this specific output. If zero the the module Zone/subzone will be used else the modules zone and the outputs sub zone will be used.

reg.name: PWM1 value
reg.description: The actual value of the PWM output.

reg.name: PWM2 value
reg.description: The actual value of the PWM output.

reg.name: PWM3 value
reg.description: The actual value of the PWM output.

reg.name: PWM4 value
reg.description: The actual value of the PWM output.

reg.name: Control byte for PWM1
reg.description:
The control bits enable/disable PWM associated functionality:
 Bit 0 - Reserved.
 Bit 1 - Reserved
 Bit 2 - Protection timer enable for associated output.
 Bit 3 - Send On event when PWM goes to active state (above treshold).
 Bit 4 - Send Off event when PWM goes to inactive state (below treshold).
 Bit 5 - Reserved.
 Bit 6 - Reserved.
 Bit 7 - If set to one the PWM is enabled.

reg.name: Control byte for PWM2
reg.description:
The control bits enable/disable PWM associated functionality:
 Bit 0 - Reserved.
 Bit 1 - Reserved
 Bit 2 - Protection timer enable for associated output.
 Bit 3 - Send On event when PWM goes to active state (above treshold).
 Bit 4 - Send Off event when PWM goes to inactive state (below treshold).
 Bit 5 - Reserved.
 Bit 6 - Reserved.
 Bit 7 - If set to one the PWM is enabled.

reg.description:

 Bit 4 - Send Off event when PWM goes to inactive state (below treshold).
 Bit 5 - Reserved.
 Bit 6 - Reserved.
 Bit 7 - If set to one the PWM is enabled.

reg.name: With PWM1 associated Output
reg.description: Output associated with PWM will be activated if above PWM treshold value\nOutput will be deactivate when beloz treshold

reg.name: With PWM2 associated Output
reg.description: Output associated with PWM will be activated if above PWM treshold value\nOutput will be deactivate when beloz treshold

reg.name: With PWM3 associated Output
reg.description: Output associated with PWM will be activated if above PWM treshold value\nOutput will be deactivate when beloz treshold

reg.name: With PWM4 associated Output
reg.description: Output associated with PWM will be activated if above PWM treshold value\nOutput will be deactivate when beloz treshold

reg.name: Treshhold PWM1
reg.description: Treshold value for associated outputs (if any) with PWM1

reg.name: Treshhold PWM2
reg.description: Treshold value for associated outputs (if any) with PWM1

reg.name: Treshhold PWM3
reg.description: Treshold value for associated outputs (if any) with PWM1

reg.name: Treshhold PWM4
reg.description: Treshold value for associated outputs (if any) with PWM1

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Oaddr
reg.description: Row 1 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0×00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: flags
reg.description:
Row 1 of decision matrix. Flags. Set selection behaviour.
 The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited.
 The zone and use subzone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/subzone information of an event. That is the zone/subzone of the machine must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.

bit.name: Class filter bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class filter.

bit.name: Class mask bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class mask.

bit.name: Reserved bit
bit.description: This bit is not used.

bit.name: Subzone match
bit.description: If set to one subzone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Zone match
bit.description: If set to one zone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Hardcoded
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Check Originating address
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: Enable (1) or disable (0)the decison matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class mask (low eight bits)
reg.description: The lowest eight bits of the class mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class mask is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class filter (low eight bits)
reg.description: The lowest eight bits of the class filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class filter is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type mask
reg.description: Type mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type filter
reg.description: Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action
reg.description: This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0×00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action parameter
reg.description: A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Oaddr
reg.description: Row 1 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0×00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: flags
reg.description:
Row 1 of decision matrix. Flags. Set selection behaviour.
 The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited.
 The zone and use subzone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/subzone information of an event. That is the zone/subzone of the machine must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.

bit.name: Class filter bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class filter.

bit.name: Class mask bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class mask.

bit.name: Reserved bit
bit.description: This bit is not used.

bit.name: Subzone match
bit.description: If set to one subzone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Zone match
bit.description: If set to one zone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Hardcoded
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Check Originating address
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: Enable (1) or disable (0)the decison matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Class mask (low eight bits)
reg.description: The lowest eight bits of the class mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class mask is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Class filter (low eight bits)
reg.description: The lowest eight bits of the class filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class filter is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Type mask
reg.description: Type mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Type filter
reg.description: Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Action
reg.description: This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0×00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Action parameter
reg.description: A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.

abstraction.name: Relay pulse time register for relay 1
abstraction.description: This is the pulse time for the each relay expressed in seconds. This can be used to have a relay turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the relay will be steady on/off.\n To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the relay status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the relay status register. \n

abstraction.name: Relay pulse time register for relay 2
abstraction.description: This is the pulse time for the each relay expressed in seconds. This can be used to have a relay turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the relay will be steady on/off.\n To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the relay status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the relay status register. \n

abstraction.name: Relay pulse time register for relay 3
abstraction.description: This is the pulse time for the each relay expressed in seconds. This can be used to have a relay turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the relay will be steady on/off.\n To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the relay status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the relay status register. \n

action.name: Activate output(s)
action.description: Activate output(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 1 and so on.\n Byte 1 is Zone and byte 2 is zone page and must be equal to register content to trigger action.\n

param.name: Bitarry for output
param.description: A bitarray where the first bit represents output one and so on.

bit.name: output 1
bit.description: Set to one to select output 1

bit.name: output 1
bit.description: Set to one to select output 1

bit.name: output 2
bit.description: Set to one to select output 2

bit.name: output 3
bit.description: Set to one to select output 3

bit.name: output 4
bit.description: Set to one to select output 4

bit.name: output 5
bit.description: Set to one to select output 5

bit.name: output 6
bit.description: Set to one to select output 6

bit.name: output 7
bit.description: Set to one to select output 7
